intro: Onopyxus pycnocephalus, commonly known as the dense-headed onopyxus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compact, clustered inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and has finely divided leaves that resemble those of other umbelliferous species. Its flowers are small and white or pale yellow, arranged in dense, spherical clusters at the top of the stem. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
